definition: to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern

sentences.english: Many years ago, my granduncle is a chef there.
sentences.chinese: 很多年前，我的舅父是里边的御厨。

sentences.english: Soon the royal cook came to kill the willing victim on the block.
sentences.chinese: 很快，御厨来宰杀砧板上心甘情愿的牺牲者了。

sentences.english: Sometimes, when he was too busy, the royal cook would do this.
sentences.chinese: 有时，他太忙了，将是御厨来杀鹿。

sentences.english: The imperial cooks prepared lunch for the emperor every day.
sentences.chinese: 御厨们每天都为皇帝准备午膳。

definition: the Manchu Han imperial feast, a legendary banquet in the Qing dynasty/(fig.) a sumptuous banquet
to be in charge of the cooking/to be the chef/head cook/chef
delicacy and fine taste (idiom); a wonderful treat
lit. Buddha jumps over the wall, name for a Chinese dish that uses many non-vegetarian ingredients
exotic delicacies/luxury foodstuff from distant locations
